word: das Verhelien, die Verhelien (no plural form)
definition: To deceive or mislead someone by concealing or withholding information, often with the intention of avoiding punishment or negative consequences. This term is commonly used to describe an act of intentionally hiding the truth or providing false information in order to protect oneself or others.

examples.german: Ich habe ihm verheißen, dass ich ihn besuchen werde.
examples.english: I promised him that I will visit him.

examples.german: Sie verheißt uns eine bessere Zukunft.
examples.english: She promises us a better future.

examples.german: Die Propheten verheißen den Untergang der Stadt.
examples.english: The prophets foretell the downfall of the city.
